div1.p: Mabel Lazear explains the breadth of support for her annuity from various groups.

div1.head: Letter from [Mabel H. Lazear] to Daniel R. Anthony, [1908?]
div1.p:
In
a communication
just received from
the War Department
I am asked to write
to you as chairman
of the House Committee
on Appropriations in
regard to my annuity
I am taking the liberty
of enclosing a letter
from the Merchant
Association of Mar. 30
1908 in order to show
you how the annuity
was indorsed by
the community at
large. 100 Commercial
& Medical Association
endorsed the Bill
to grant me at
annuity - also please
find copy of Bill
enclosed which will
explain my husband
Dr Lazears' work on
the yellow fever commission

As regards my health
please find Doctor
certificate and to
the finalized stand-
ing I am at present
entirely dependent
for my living upon
this annuity.

I will be very glad
to furnish any
information I can
about this Annuity
It had the hearty support
of Pres Roosevelt
Mr Mead asking
and many others of our
Shall I telegraph to
prominent - citizens
